Basic details: Margaret Green, a 58-year-old female, presents to the clinic with a complaint of chronic cough lasting for several months.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 18/minute

Physical presentation:
Sit upright and occasionally cough into a tissue.
Appear slightly fatigued and clear your throat frequently.

Challenging question: "Could this be something serious like lung cancer?"
